title: 1998 RMO - extension question
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inspiration","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" - thanks to Michael Huang for posting the first problem."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A positive integer is written on a board. We repeatedly erase its unit digit and add "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times that digit to what remains."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the sequence of numbers generated in this manner. What is the eventual behaviour of this sequence?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One or more of the following can happen: depending on the initial number on the board, the sequence..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can tend to infinity"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can tend to a unique fixed value"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can tend to any one of several (finitely many, but more than one) fixed values"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can tend to any one of infinitely many fixed values"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can become periodic with a period length greater than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can become periodic with a period length greater than or equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"can become periodic with a period length greater than or equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Code the options you think are possible as a seven-digit binary number, and enter its decimal equivalent as your answer. For example, if you think the first, third and fifth options are possible, your binary number would be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1010100_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and you would enter "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"84"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as your answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[An example to clarify the answer options: if instead we looked at repeatedly summing the digits of a positive number, the only correct option would be the third one - it will always tend to a fixed, single digit value]"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The correct answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"38=0100110_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One of three things can happen to the sequence:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it can tend to the fixed point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it can become periodic with period "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (the numbers in the cycle are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7\to35\to28\to42\to14\to21\to7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":")"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it can become periodic with period "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"42"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (the numbers in this cycle are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1\to5\to25\to27\to \cdots \to20\to2\to10\to1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":")"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The length "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"42"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cycle is made up of all the numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"48"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" excluding multiples of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To prove nothing else can happen, consider the map: we take a number of the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a single digit and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a non-negative integer) and replace it with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+5b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The difference of these is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Delta=10a+b-(a+5b)=9a-4b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The largest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be (as a single digit) is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; so if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a>4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Delta>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", meaning that any number larger than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is mapped to a smaller number. Eventually the terms must fall into the range "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and become periodic (or fixed) as described above."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y,z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be positive integers such that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{x}- \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the greatest common divisor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y,z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"hxyz"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h(y-x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are not perfect squares. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Is this statement true or false?"}]}]}

Therefore, y-x=kh for some integer k 
And khxyz=(xy)^2
So, hxyz=(xy)^2/k but since I can be any integer not necessarily a square no. Therefore hxyz could not be perfect square all time."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 199 Followers, Waiting for the another one.
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the area enclosed by the conic:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{13x^2 + 13y^2 - 10xy -60 \sqrt{2} x + 12 \sqrt{2} y +72 = 0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If you think that the conic is not a closed path, then type your answer as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"At first,rotate the the co-ordinate axes through "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" degrees(anticlockwise) to get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{(x'-3)^2}{9}+\frac{(y'+2)^2}{4}=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the area is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the above I used the following:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1.The transformation equation for rotaion of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"θ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=x'cosθ-y'sinθ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=x'sinθ+y'cosθ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2.I chose "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"θ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" degrees to eliminate the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"xy"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" term."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the area exists, this must be an ellipse. First we center the conic at the origin: transform "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x' = x - u"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y' = y - v"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that the linear terms disappear."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This requires
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \left\{\begin{array}{l} 26u - 10v = 60\sqrt2, \\
-10u + 26v = -12\sqrt 2\end{array}\right.;"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
the solution is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u = 2\tfrac12\sqrt 2, v = \tfrac12\sqrt 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In these new coordinates, the conic becomes
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 13(x')^2 + 13(y')^2 - 10 x'y' - 72 = 0. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To get rid of the mixed term "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x'y'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we rotate the coordinate system. Since the coefficients of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are equal, a rotation of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will do. (More generally, one could find the eigenvectors of the coefficient matrix, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left(\begin{array}{cc} 13 & -5 \\ -5 & 13\end{array}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and use those as the new coordinate axes.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus we set
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x' = \frac{\xi + \eta}{\sqrt 2}, y' = \frac{\xi - \eta}{\sqrt 2}:"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac{13}{2}(\xi + \eta)^2 + \frac{13}{2}(\xi - \eta)^2 - \frac{10}{2}(\xi + \eta)(\xi - \eta) - 72 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 8\xi^2 + 18\eta^2 - 72 = 0."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
This is the equation of an ellipse, with semiaxes
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = \sqrt{\frac{72}{8}} = 3, b = \sqrt{\frac{72}{18}} = 2."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
(We chose the rotation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x',y') \mapsto (\xi,\eta)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in such a way that lengths are preserved.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The area of the ellipse is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A = ab\pi = 2\cdot3\cdot \pi\ \dot{=}\ 18.84955592."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Rarely done but this is done. Not only a ratio of 3 : 2 but a = 3 and b = 2."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45 degrees turned from positive real axis before transition, centered at [5 Sqrt(2)/ 2, Sqrt(2)/ 2] after transition, this is an ellipse."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Transforms by rotation about the origin via parametric equations, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cos Q and Sin Q are obtained in f(a, b, x, y) by Cramer's method and sum of their squares equals to 1 eliminates to form its equation. -10 x y is based to obtain ratio of a/ b = 3/ 2. (-26 p x + 10 q x) and (-26 q y + 10 p y) tells the center (p, q). [Turn, center and size.]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Constant term = 13 p^2 + 13 q^2 - 10 p q - 8 a^2 = 144 - 8 a^2 = 72 => a = 3."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To change the size of the transformed ellipse, just change the constant term of 72."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"With a = 3 and b = 2, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Area enclosed = Pi (3)(2) = 6 Pi = 18.849555921538759430775860299677 {Square units}"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
